info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 7:28PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lewis and Clark and southwestern Cascade Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 727 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southwest of Wolf Creek, or 18 miles northwest of Helena, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wolf Creek, Canyon Creek and Craig. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 207 and 239. Highway 287 between mile markers 1 and 2 . MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
